title: Kyle Sandilands reveals he used 'secret midnight hotel meetings' to secure deal with KIIS FM
text:
Kyle Sandilands and co-host Jackie 'O' Henderson are each set to earn an estimated $8million annually as part of their new five-year contract with ARN (KIIS FM).

About to enter their sixth year with the radio network, Kyle has revealed how he used 'sneaky midnight hotel room meetings' to jump ship from SCA (2DAY FM) in 2013.

Kyle, 48, told The Sunday Telegraph that his former employer were planning on axing the pair, and he wasn't ready to go down without a fight.

'I smoked a couple of joints and made phone calls': Kyle Sandilands reveals he used 'secret midnight hotel meetings' to secure deal with KIIS FM and laughed at 2DAY FM's bid to get the Kyle And Jackie O show back

Kyle and Jackie O have been a successful radio duo since hosting the Hot 30 Countdown in the early 2000s. They debuted their breakfast show in 2005.

'They basically told us "you’ve been on together for 10 years so it’s time for a refresh"... Despite being number one,' Kyle claimed.

According to Kyle, the pair were told their contract with Southern Cross Austereo (2DAY FM) would not be renewed at the end of 2013. And he wasn't happy.

'They basically told us it’s time for a refresh': About to enter their sixth year with KIIS FM, Kyle said he jumped ship from 2DAY FM in 2013 after they were told they'd be axed

'I got angry': Kyle said he took matters into his own hands and starting calling around to secure another network for the show

'It goes without saying I got angry. I calmed down by smoking a couple of joints and started to make phone calls,' Kyle told the publication.

He added: 'Before I knew it, and after a few sneaky midnight hotel room meetings, I had entered Jackie and I into negotiations with the Australian Radio Network (ARN). The rest is history.'

Kyle has since described the new $80million contract he and Jackie have signed until 2024 with ARN as 'the biggest media deal in Australian history'.

'I laughed': According to Kyle it didn't take long for his former 2DAY FM bosses to attempt to get the stars back, claiming they offered $5 million a year to the duo

According to Kyle it didn't take long for his former 2DAY FM bosses to attempt to get the stars back, claiming they offered $5 million a year to the duo.

'I laughed and said "I’m already on more than that here",' he recalled.

Since the Kyle And Jackie O show left 2DAY FM almost six years ago, the station has consistently struggled to find an equally-successful replacement.
description: Kyle Sandilands and co-host Jackie 'O' Henderson are each set to earn an estimated $8million annually as part of their new five-year contract with ARN (KIIS FM).
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
